hBBCiCpLJsOEEEIIIYQQQgghhBBCCCFElfV/lFjW6HSoitgAAAAASUVORK5CYII=
">
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> Analysis of the above visualization: </strong></p>
<p>A Scatterplot matrices is a great way to roughly determine if you have a linear correlation between multiple variables. This is particularly helpful in pinpointing specific variables that might have similar correlations amongst the dataset. Some observations are as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li>Calories burnt show approximately linear correlation with the minutes of a particular activity and the steps taken. </li>
<li>Heteroskedasticity is observed for variables calories with activity Minutes and also activityMins and elevationGain.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="IV.-Executive-Summary">IV. Executive Summary<a class="anchor-link" href="#IV.-Executive-Summary">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I have been an avid runner and fitness enthusiast for the past 5 years, and have been capturing data about my training activities. One of the main motivations to do this analysis was to gain insights into my running patterns, my strength training schedules and any relevant information I can collect using all the data I have collected from my training sessions.</p>
<p>During the span of five years, I have changed 4 wearable devices. Initially I used the Garmin Vivofit tracker for all the runs, which did not have heart rate tracker. After that I used the Garmin Forerunner 920 (GPS inbuilt), which had a heart rate strap along with it and it also used to calculate the elevationGain and many more parameters for all the runs. The third tracker used was the Garmin Vivofit2 tracker, which had inbuilt heart rate monitor but lacked GPS, so the runs were still being tracked by Garmin Forerunner 920 and whenever were tracked using Vivofit2, lacked heart rate information. Currently I am using the Garmin Vivoactive HR, which has an wrist HR monitor as well as an inbuilt GPS.</p>
<p>In the summary, I will highlight the following main insights from the analysis:</p>
<ul>
<li>Hour of the day I perform the activities and how it has varied in the last 5 years?</li>
<li>For every month of the past 5 years, how has the total activity time varied?</li>
<li>Also, for the last 5 years, how has the running mileage varied and its comparison to the activity times?</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> For the analysis about the hour of the day I have performed the activities, I created the following interactive visualization using D3.js: <a href="https://anujk3.github.io/edav-project/vis2.html">Visualization Link</a></strong> (Inspired by learning from the course <em>Storytelling with Data</em>) <a href="https://github.com/anujk3/edav-project/blob/master/vis2.html">Code</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">HTML</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'<iframe width="995" height="910" frameborder="0" src="http://anujkatiyal.com/edav-project/vis2.html" allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe>'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> About the Visualization </strong> : In this specific visualization created using D3.js, the activities have been plotted as a scatter plot in increasing order of time range from 2012 to 2017. Knowing that the activities span a range of 5 years, I made the decision to not keep tick labels for x-axis but added a Data Range Slider below the x-axis to add interactivity to the plot (a date range can be chosen). The y-axis shows the time of the day (0-24 hours) and the activities are plotted as points on the graph. Also interactive buttons can be used to select any activity, like running, cycling etc. and only its patterns can be observed for a given date range.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <strong>main insights</strong> that can be obtained from the visualization are as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li>Most of the activity sessions for the past 5 years have been in the evening, which clearly show that I am not really a morning person. </li>
<li>Most of the morning sessions included running, which were the practice runs while training for marathons.</li>
<li>Since moving to New York in August 2016, the rightmost part of the graph, I have mostly been doing the strength sessions late night at around 22:00 hour and some really late night cycle rides along the riverside, which can be clearly seen in the visualization. The increase in the cycling sessions after moving to New York can be attributed to the annual Citibike membership and daily usage of it during the Winter vacations after Fall 2016 semester.</li>
<li>The fitness tracking journey started with mostly tracking the runs (leftmost part of the chart consist mostly of green dots) and slowly with the improved fitness trackers bought, I started capturing more data about varied activities I did.</li>
<li>And looking at this visualization, I also realize that in the recent times, I have been missing the feel good factor after my long runs, and need to get back to running soon. It is clearly visible that I have mostly been focusing on the strength training sessions (rightmost pink clusters) in the recent times.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> To understand the total activity time and how it varied for the last 5 years during specific months, I created the following D3 visualization : <a href="https://anujk3.github.io/edav-project/vis3.html">Visualization Link</a></strong> (Inspired by learning from the course <em>Storytelling with Data</em>) <a href="https://github.com/anujk3/edav-project/blob/master/vis3.html">Code</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">HTML</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'<iframe width="995" height="720" frameborder="0" src="http://anujkatiyal.com/edav-project/vis3.html" allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe>'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>About the visualization</strong> : In this specific visualization created using D3.js, the total aggregated minutes of the activity types have been plotted on the y-axis with its variation across the months for the years 2012-2016. The trend line plots have been specifically annotated for every year in the analysis. Hovering the mouse on the visualization highlights the closest data points and annotates it in the visualization with the minutes spent in that month. For this visualization, I am using curved lines which help us better understand the underlying variations in the data.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <strong>main insights</strong> that can be obtained from the visualization are as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li>The tracking for the workout sessions began in 2012, with about 200 minutes of activity captured during the month of October 2012, but I was still not much into tracking at that time.</li>
<li>During the year 2013, I started tracking my running activities only and most of the activity minutes for the months in 2013 are due to the runs that have been tracked.</li>
<li>During the year 2014, I started my running journey and joined the Gurgaon Road Runners group and got inspired to track my runs more seriously. Even though I was still only capturing my runs for the year, I had a decent running time during most of the months from March - May. The time spent on running activities reduced because of extreme hot temperatures in India during June and July and then the I started training for a half marathon, due to which the activity minutes picked up during the end months of 2014.</li>
<li>During the year 2015, I just ran a half marathon for the month of January and after that had a cool down period. Because of the advanced fitness trackers bought during 2015, from June I started capturing my strength training sessions along with the running sessions and along with it, I started preparing for a half marathon in December and full marathon in January, because of which there has been a high value of activity minutes recorded for the last half of 2015 season.</li>
<li>For the year 2016, I was running regularly and also training regularly for improving my runs in the gym, because of which there has been such high activity recorded for the year 2016. I also ran my first full marathon in January 2016 and therefore have high activity recorded for the month of January 2016. The reduction in activity minutes as 2016 progressed can be aided to the joining of Graduate school in NY and recording mostly my strength training sessions. </li>
</ul>
<p>Even though the activity minutes reduced as the year 2016 progressed, I was still capturing all my other training sessions than running and do have decent activity minutes captured. The difference of how graduate school really impacted my running schedule will be clearly visible from the following visualization of just the running kilometers tracked for the years 2014-2016.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> And, finally lets look at the running kilometers tracked for every month in the years 2014-2016. The result is shown in the following visualization created using D3.js : <a href="https://anujk3.github.io/edav-project/vis4.html">Visualization Link</a></strong> (Inspired by learning from the course <em>Storytelling with Data</em>) <a href="https://github.com/anujk3/edav-project/blob/master/vis4.html">Code</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">HTML</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'<iframe width="995" height="720" frameborder="0" src="http://anujkatiyal.com/edav-project/vis4.html" allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe>'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>About the visualization</strong> : In this specific visualization created using D3.js, the running mileage has been plotted for every month of the years 2014-2016 with the running mileage on the y-axis and the months on the x-axis. I am only showing the data for these years as I was mostly capturing all my running activities during these years. The trend line plots have been specifically annotated for every year in the analysis. Hovering the mouse on the visualization highlights the closest data points and annotates it in the visualization with the total kilometers run in that month. For this visualization, I am using curved lines which help us better understand the underlying variations in the data.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <strong>main insights</strong> that can be obtained from the visualization are as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li>For the year 2014, the running time has mostly varied with the running season in India. The running season starts around August and finishes with the Delhi Marathon and Mumbai Marathon in Decemeber and January respectively, showing higher kilometers run during those times of the year.</li>
<li>For the year 2015, after the Mumbai Marathon in January is when you rest and condition your body for the next running season. Even though in the previous plot I see that the recorded activity time is very high for the months in 2015, the actual running miles is less till the beginning of the running season in August-September. As I was preparing for my first full marathon in January 2016, the higher kilometer runs for the month of November and December 2015 are the due to the practice long runs for its preparation.</li>
<li>For the year 2016, the running kilometers are high for the year January when I was doing the practice runs and also ran my first full marathon. After that, I was just running about a long run once a week to keep conditioning along with the rest time after the season. In July-August 2016, I was preparing and moved to NY to join graduate school and during the initial months of moving to NY, I was still logging those kilometers due to the vicinity of Central Park near my house and favorable weather conditions but as the semester proceeded and the workload increased along with extreme temperature, the running kilometers reduced significantly to even less than 10km, which is really insignificant when compared to the previous years peak running months, i.e., November and Decemeber. But I hope to be back to running soon, and doing this analysis just made me realize how important running is for my happiness.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We will now proceed to the section where we will try and obtain more trends from the data, analyze the distributions of important variables in the dataset and obtain learning by analyzing all the created visualizations from the data.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="V.-Main-Data-Analysis-and-Visualizations">V. Main Data Analysis and Visualizations<a class="anchor-link" href="#V.-Main-Data-Analysis-and-Visualizations">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> In this section, we will analyze the identified important features through our data quality analysis, namely, <code>Activity Minutes</code>, <code>Activity Month</code>, <code>Activity Day</code> and <code>Calories Burnt</code>. </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><a id="section1"></a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="i.-Analysis-of-the-feature---Activity-Minutes">i. Analysis of the feature - Activity Minutes<a class="anchor-link" href="#i.-Analysis-of-the-feature---Activity-Minutes">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> <em>a. Distribution Histogram with overlayed Density Plots, with varying binwidths also</em> </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [41]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">900</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"ggplot2"</span><span class="p">)</span>

g1 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>activityMins<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Count"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes overlayed with density estimate : Binwidth 1"</span><span class="p">)</span> 
g1
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [42]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">900</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"ggplot2"</span><span class="p">)</span>

multiplot <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kc">...</span><span class="p">,</span> plotlist<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">NULL</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kp">file</span><span class="p">,</span> cols<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span> layout<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">NULL</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
  <span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>grid<span class="p">)</span>

  <span class="c1"># Make a list from the ... arguments and plotlist</span>
  plots <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kt">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kc">...</span><span class="p">),</span> plotlist<span class="p">)</span>

  numPlots <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">length</span><span class="p">(</span>plots<span class="p">)</span>

  <span class="c1"># If layout is NULL, then use 'cols' to determine layout</span>
  <span class="kr">if</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">is.null</span><span class="p">(</span>layout<span class="p">))</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="c1"># Make the panel</span>
    <span class="c1"># ncol: Number of columns of plots</span>
    <span class="c1"># nrow: Number of rows needed, calculated from # of cols</span>
    layout <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">matrix</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">seq</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span> cols <span class="o">*</span> <span class="kp">ceiling</span><span class="p">(</span>numPlots<span class="o">/</span>cols<span class="p">)),</span>
                    ncol <span class="o">=</span> cols<span class="p">,</span> nrow <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">ceiling</span><span class="p">(</span>numPlots<span class="o">/</span>cols<span class="p">))</span>
  <span class="p">}</span>

 <span class="kr">if</span> <span class="p">(</span>numPlots<span class="o">==</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="kp">print</span><span class="p">(</span>plots<span class="p">[[</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">]])</span>

  <span class="p">}</span> <span class="kr">else</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="c1"># Set up the page</span>
    grid.newpage<span class="p">()</span>
    pushViewport<span class="p">(</span>viewport<span class="p">(</span>layout <span class="o">=</span> grid.layout<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">nrow</span><span class="p">(</span>layout<span class="p">),</span> <span class="kp">ncol</span><span class="p">(</span>layout<span class="p">))))</span>

    <span class="c1"># Make each plot, in the correct location</span>
    <span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>i <span class="kr">in</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span>numPlots<span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
      <span class="c1"># Get the i,j matrix positions of the regions that contain this subplot</span>
      matchidx <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">as.data.frame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">which</span><span class="p">(</span>layout <span class="o">==</span> i<span class="p">,</span> arr.ind <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">))</span>

      <span class="kp">print</span><span class="p">(</span>plots<span class="p">[[</span>i<span class="p">]],</span> vp <span class="o">=</span> viewport<span class="p">(</span>layout.pos.row <span class="o">=</span> matchidx<span class="o">$</span><span class="kp">row</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                      layout.pos.col <span class="o">=</span> matchidx<span class="o">$</span><span class="kp">col</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="p">}</span>
  <span class="p">}</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
g1 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>activityMins<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Count"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes overlayed with density estimate : Binwidth 1"</span><span class="p">)</span>

g2 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>activityMins<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Count"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes overlayed with density estimate : Binwidth 2"</span><span class="p">)</span>

g3 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>activityMins<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">4</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Count"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes overlayed with density estimate : Binwidth 4"</span><span class="p">)</span>

g4 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>activityMins<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">6</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>count..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Count"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes overlayed with density estimate : Binwidth 6"</span><span class="p">)</span>

multiplot<span class="p">(</span>g1<span class="p">,</span> g2<span class="p">,</span> g3<span class="p">,</span> g4<span class="p">,</span> cols<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> Analysis of the above visualization: </strong></p>
<ol>
<li>In the plot above, we see a distribution of Activity Minutes on the x-axis along with the count of those activities on the y-axis.</li>
<li>The Distribution is clearly multi-modal skewed towards the right. Varying the binwidths also led to similar distributions showing the underlying pattern of the distribution.</li>
<li>Reasons for skewness include the practice runs while I was training for my first full Marathon in 2016, the full marathon and also instances when I forgot to stop the timer while recording activities.</li>
<li>Activity Minutes data obtained was mostly clean, except for instances when I forgot to turn of the fitness tracker resulting into longer workouts, but they were cleaned during the data cleaning process.</li>
</ol>
</div>

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">900</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"ggplot2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"viridis"</span><span class="p">)</span>

g1 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>activityMins<span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span>activityType<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">0.5</span><span class="p">,</span> adjust <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span> na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>   <span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Density"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Activity Minutes"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> scale_fill_viridis<span class="p">(</span>discrete<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Distribution of Activity Minutes for the different Activity Types"</span><span class="p">)</span>
g1
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> Analysis of the above visualization: </strong></p>
<ol>
<li>In the plot above, we see a distribution of Activity Minutes on the x-axis along with the density of those activities on the y-axis for all the activity Types.</li>
<li>The Distributions are nearly normal or skewed towards the right, which is a nice observation and helps me understand the usual minutes I spend doing a particular activity type.</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> <em>c. Analysis of Outliers : Activity Minutes for the activities</em> </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [44]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">900</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"ggplot2"</span><span class="p">)</span>

fill <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="s">"#4271AE"</span>
line <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="s">"#1F3552"</span>

ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">factor</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">),</span> y<span class="o">=</span>activityMins<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> geom_boxplot<span class="p">(</span>fill <span class="o">=</span> fill<span class="p">,</span> colour <span class="o">=</span> line<span class="p">,</span> notch <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">,</span> width<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">0.2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    guides<span class="p">(</span>fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">FALSE</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> coord_flip<span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    theme<span class="p">(</span>axis.title.y<span class="o">=</span>element_blank<span class="p">(),</span>
        axis.text.y<span class="o">=</span>element_blank<span class="p">(),</span>
        axis.ticks.y<span class="o">=</span>element_blank<span class="p">())</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Distribution of Activity Minutes along all the activities"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> facet_wrap<span class="p">(</span> <span class="o">~</span> activityType<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> Analysis of the above visualization: </strong></p>
<ol>
<li>In the plot above, we want to analyze the outliers for each Activity Type of the total Activity Minutes.</li>
<li>The outliers in the right direction bring a smile to my face, as possibly those are the days I pushed myself and I don't want to comment on the outliers on the left side. The boxplots do help me understand the usual time zones doing a particular activity clearly.</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><a id="section2"></a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="ii.-Analysis-of-the-feature---Activity-Month">ii. Analysis of the feature - Activity Month<a class="anchor-link" href="#ii.-Analysis-of-the-feature---Activity-Month">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> <em>a. How many total activities have I done in every month for the past 5 years?</em> </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [45]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">running_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"activityMonthName"</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s2">"activityMonth"</span><span class="p">]]</span>
<span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'activityMonth'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Count'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># running_data_gMonth.head()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [46]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data_gMonth <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">800</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"ggplot2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"viridis"</span><span class="p">)</span>

orderedclasses <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"January"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"February"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"March"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"April"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"May"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"June"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"July"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"August"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"September"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"October"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"November"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"December"</span><span class="p">)</span>
running_data_gMonth<span class="o">$</span>activityMonthName <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">factor</span><span class="p">(</span>running_data_gMonth<span class="o">$</span>activityMonthName<span class="p">,</span> levels <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">rev</span><span class="p">(</span>orderedclasses<span class="p">))</span>

ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data_gMonth<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> activityMonthName<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> Count<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  geom_col<span class="p">(</span>fill <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"#1f77b4"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  coord_flip<span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  theme<span class="p">(</span>legend.position<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"none"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Month"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Number of Workout Sessions"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Counts of the workouts in Specific Months over the last 5 years"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> Analysis of the above visualization: </strong></p>
<ol>
<li>In the plot above, I am showing the total number of workouts done in every month.</li>
<li>Okay, I will admit, this was an eye opener for me. I thought I have been regular to the gym, but the plot shows something different. The difference between the numbers can also be accounted for not tracking the specific workout sessions other than running for the years 2012-2014.</li>
<li>In the last 2 years, I have been tracking all my running workouts and the gym sessions and am happy that for some months atleast the number of workouts in the last 2-3 years did touch values greater 50, i.e., March, October and December specifically - probably the onset of Spring Season and the running season.</li>
<li>June has been the most dormant month for me, probably because of the extreme season(heat) in India during that time.</li>
<li>During the visualization purpose, the ordering of factors was required to show the result in increasing order of months.</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> <em>b. How many specific activities have I done in every month for the past 5 years?</em> </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [47]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">running_data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"activityYear"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">running_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">startTime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">year</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [48]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">running_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"activityYear"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"activityMonthName"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"activityType"</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [49]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s2">"activityMonth"</span><span class="p">]]</span>
<span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">running_data_gMonth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'activityMonth'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Count'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [50]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data_gMonth <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">900</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"ggplot2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"viridis"</span><span class="p">)</span>

orderedclasses <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"January"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"February"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"March"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"April"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"May"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"June"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"July"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"August"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"September"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"October"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"November"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"December"</span><span class="p">)</span>
running_data_gMonth<span class="o">$</span>activityMonthName <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">factor</span><span class="p">(</span>running_data_gMonth<span class="o">$</span>activityMonthName<span class="p">,</span> levels <span class="o">=</span> orderedclasses<span class="p">)</span>

ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data_gMonth<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> activityMonthName<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> Count<span class="p">,</span> fill <span class="o">=</span> activityType<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  geom_col<span class="p">(</span>position<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"dodge"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Month"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Number of Workout Sessions"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Counts of the workouts in Specific Months from 2012-2017"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> scale_fill_viridis<span class="p">(</span>discrete<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> Analysis of the above visualization: </strong></p>
<ol>
<li>In the plot above, I am showing the total number of workouts done in every month for every activity type.</li>
<li>Some interesting facts come out of this analysis:<ul>
<li>I have not tracked a strength training session for the Months of June and July, which makes it clear that I bought a device with that capability in 2016 around July and started capturing the strength sessions after that.</li>
<li>Cardio sessions are high during the summer season as compared to August - December which is the running season. </li>
<li>Cycling sessions are few and indicate to citibike rides in NY after coming here in August 2016.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> <em>c. Faceted by Year of the activity</em> </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [51]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data_gMonth <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">1000</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">800</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"ggplot2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"viridis"</span><span class="p">)</span>

orderedclasses <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"January"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"February"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"March"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"April"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"May"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"June"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"July"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"August"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"September"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"October"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"November"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"December"</span><span class="p">)</span>
running_data_gMonth<span class="o">$</span>activityMonthName <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">factor</span><span class="p">(</span>running_data_gMonth<span class="o">$</span>activityMonthName<span class="p">,</span> levels <span class="o">=</span> orderedclasses<span class="p">)</span>

ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data_gMonth<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> activityMonthName<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> Count<span class="p">,</span> fill <span class="o">=</span> activityType<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  geom_col<span class="p">(</span>position<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"dodge"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> facet_wrap<span class="p">(</span><span class="o">~</span> activityYear<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Month"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Number of Workout Sessions"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Counts of the workouts in Specific Months over the last 4 years"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> scale_fill_viridis<span class="p">(</span>discrete<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  theme<span class="p">(</span>axis.text.x <span class="o">=</span> element_text<span class="p">(</span>angle <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">90</span><span class="p">,</span> hjust <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> Analysis of the above visualization: </strong></p>
<ol>
<li>In the plot above, I am showing the total number of workouts done in every month for every activity type faceted by Years.</li>
<li>I will write about every year and see how the journey has evolved,<ul>
<li><strong>2012 and 2013</strong> - Got into fitness tracking with a very basic first generation Garmin Vivofit and tracked a few runs and cycle session. Still was not much into tracking or realized importance of tracking the workouts.</li>
<li><strong>2014</strong> - I started working at a company in Gurgaon, India and became a member of the running group Gurgaon Road Runners and that is how I got into fitness, and used to track all my runs with them. I did my first Delhi Half Marathon in December 2014 and tracked all my practice runs before it.</li>
<li><strong>2015</strong> - The year I got into a rhythm of running and understood the idea of doing a few half marathons, then resting body for a few months before preparing for another marathon. I was tracking mostly my running sessions during the first half of the year but then I bought a better Garmin device with the ability to track my workouts also and I started capturing my strength training and cardio sessions from the second half of 2015.</li>
<li><strong>2016</strong> - I was regular to gym, yoga and running and ran my first full marathon in January 2017. Also, tbe number of running sessions reduced significantly when I moved to NY in August 2016, but the strength training sessions increased.</li>
<li><strong>2017</strong> - I have actually observed a decrease in running but tried and kept pace with the Strength training sessions which can be owed to a tough semester in Graduate School aided by extreme climate conditions.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>For faceted visualizations, the ordering always needs to be taken care of. Also, the patterns and trends were observed using horizontal bars as well as vertical bars and vertical bars made more sense for this case.</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><a id="section3"></a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="iii.-Analysis-of-the-feature---Activity-Day">iii. Analysis of the feature - Activity Day<a class="anchor-link" href="#iii.-Analysis-of-the-feature---Activity-Day">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>A summary for both the visualizations made for the feature analysis of Activity Day has been provided in the end.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> <em>a. Which activities on which day of the week?</em> </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [52]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">running_data_activDay</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">running_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"activityDayName"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"activityType"</span><span class="p">])[[</span><span class="s1">'activityDay'</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">running_data_activDay</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'activityDay'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Count'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">running_data_activDay</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1">#running_data_activDay</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [53]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data_activDay <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">900</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>tidyverse<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>ggplot2<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>gridExtra<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"viridis"</span><span class="p">)</span>

orderedclasses <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Monday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Tuesday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Wednesday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Thursday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Friday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Saturday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Sunday"</span><span class="p">)</span>
running_data_activDay<span class="o">$</span>activityDayName <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">factor</span><span class="p">(</span>running_data_activDay<span class="o">$</span>activityDayName<span class="p">,</span> levels <span class="o">=</span> orderedclasses<span class="p">)</span>


g1 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data_activDay<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> activityDayName<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> Count<span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span>activityType<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  geom_col<span class="p">(</span>position <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"dodge"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>  scale_fill_viridis<span class="p">(</span>discrete<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Day of the week"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Frequency of Workouts"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"For every specific activity type, what has been the frequency on specific days of the week for years 2012-17?"</span><span class="p">)</span>
g1
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> <em>b. Which activities on which day of the week, faceted by activity?</em> </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [54]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data_activDay <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">900</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

orderedclasses <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Monday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Tuesday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Wednesday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Thursday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Friday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Saturday"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Sunday"</span><span class="p">)</span>
running_data_activDay<span class="o">$</span>activityDayName <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">factor</span><span class="p">(</span>running_data_activDay<span class="o">$</span>activityDayName<span class="p">,</span> levels <span class="o">=</span> orderedclasses<span class="p">)</span>

g2 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data_activDay<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> activityDayName<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> Count<span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span>activityType<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  geom_col<span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">+</span> facet_wrap<span class="p">(</span><span class="o">~</span>activityType<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> scale_fill_viridis<span class="p">(</span>discrete<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Day of the week"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Frequency of Workouts"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> theme<span class="p">(</span>axis.text.x <span class="o">=</span> element_text<span class="p">(</span>angle <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">90</span><span class="p">,</span> hjust <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span>
  ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"For every specific activity type, what has been the frequency on specific days of the week for 2012-17?"</span><span class="p">)</span>
g2
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> Analysis of the above visualizations: </strong></p>
<ol>
<li>In the plots above, I am showing the total number of workouts done on a specific day of the week over the last 5 years of tracked workouts.</li>
<li>The obvious patterns from the plots are as follows:<ul>
<li>The strength training sessions are evenly distributed over all the days of the week except for Sundays (rest day/running day).</li>
<li>The running count increases as I go into the week with the highest running frequency on the weekends.</li>
<li>The number of cardio and treadmill running sessions are few as compared to the other workouts but they are mostly evenly distributed throughout the week.</li>
<li>Cycling sessions have been tracked only since I moved to NY in September 2016, and are few and mostly during the end of the week (Wednesday - Sunday).</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Both the visualizations shown are similar to each other, but using the dodge position in the first visualization helps make the comparison amongst activities clear and using faceted diagrams in the second case help make the distinctions clear.</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><a id="section4"></a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="iv.-Analysis-of-the-feature---Calories-Burnt">iv. Analysis of the feature - Calories Burnt<a class="anchor-link" href="#iv.-Analysis-of-the-feature---Calories-Burnt">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong> <em>a. Distribution Histogram with overlayed Density Plots and also with varying binwidths</em> </strong></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [55]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">900</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"ggplot2"</span><span class="p">)</span>

ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>calories<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Density"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt overlayed with density estimate"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [56]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span>R <span class="o">-</span>i running_data <span class="o">-</span>w <span class="m">900</span> <span class="o">-</span>h <span class="m">480</span> <span class="o">-</span>u px

<span class="kn">require</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"ggplot2"</span><span class="p">)</span>

multiplot <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kc">...</span><span class="p">,</span> plotlist<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">NULL</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kp">file</span><span class="p">,</span> cols<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span> layout<span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">NULL</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
  <span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>grid<span class="p">)</span>

  <span class="c1"># Make a list from the ... arguments and plotlist</span>
  plots <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kt">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kc">...</span><span class="p">),</span> plotlist<span class="p">)</span>

  numPlots <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">length</span><span class="p">(</span>plots<span class="p">)</span>

  <span class="c1"># If layout is NULL, then use 'cols' to determine layout</span>
  <span class="kr">if</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">is.null</span><span class="p">(</span>layout<span class="p">))</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="c1"># Make the panel</span>
    <span class="c1"># ncol: Number of columns of plots</span>
    <span class="c1"># nrow: Number of rows needed, calculated from # of cols</span>
    layout <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">matrix</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">seq</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span> cols <span class="o">*</span> <span class="kp">ceiling</span><span class="p">(</span>numPlots<span class="o">/</span>cols<span class="p">)),</span>
                    ncol <span class="o">=</span> cols<span class="p">,</span> nrow <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">ceiling</span><span class="p">(</span>numPlots<span class="o">/</span>cols<span class="p">))</span>
  <span class="p">}</span>

 <span class="kr">if</span> <span class="p">(</span>numPlots<span class="o">==</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="kp">print</span><span class="p">(</span>plots<span class="p">[[</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">]])</span>

  <span class="p">}</span> <span class="kr">else</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="c1"># Set up the page</span>
    grid.newpage<span class="p">()</span>
    pushViewport<span class="p">(</span>viewport<span class="p">(</span>layout <span class="o">=</span> grid.layout<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">nrow</span><span class="p">(</span>layout<span class="p">),</span> <span class="kp">ncol</span><span class="p">(</span>layout<span class="p">))))</span>

    <span class="c1"># Make each plot, in the correct location</span>
    <span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>i <span class="kr">in</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span>numPlots<span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
      <span class="c1"># Get the i,j matrix positions of the regions that contain this subplot</span>
      matchidx <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">as.data.frame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">which</span><span class="p">(</span>layout <span class="o">==</span> i<span class="p">,</span> arr.ind <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">))</span>

      <span class="kp">print</span><span class="p">(</span>plots<span class="p">[[</span>i<span class="p">]],</span> vp <span class="o">=</span> viewport<span class="p">(</span>layout.pos.row <span class="o">=</span> matchidx<span class="o">$</span><span class="kp">row</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                      layout.pos.col <span class="o">=</span> matchidx<span class="o">$</span><span class="kp">col</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="p">}</span>
  <span class="p">}</span>
<span class="p">}</span>

g1 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>calories<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Density"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt overlayed with density estimate"</span><span class="p">)</span>

g2 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>calories<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">15</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Density"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt overlayed with density estimate"</span><span class="p">)</span>

g3 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>calories<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">20</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Density"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt overlayed with density estimate"</span><span class="p">)</span>

g4 <span class="o"><-</span> ggplot<span class="p">(</span>running_data<span class="p">,</span> aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>calories<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    geom_histogram<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span>      <span class="c1"># Histogram with density instead of count on y-axis</span>
                   binwidth<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">25</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   colour<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"black"</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"white"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_density<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>y<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">..</span>density..<span class="p">),</span> alpha<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">.2</span><span class="p">,</span> fill<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#FF6666"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span><span class="c1"># Overlay with transparent density plot</span>
    ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Density"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Calories Burnt overlayed with density estimate"</span><span class="p">)</span>

multiplot<span class="p">(</span>g1<span class="p">,</span> g2<span class="p">,</span> g3<span class="p">,</span> g4<span class="p">,</span> cols<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
